intro: Tournefortia leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stalked tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Tournefortia leptostachya is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
